column4: I've determined that Xine is making it so that I can't play MP3s. Is it ok to uninstall Xine and it's related packages? Or is Xine a nessicary package?
I can safely uninstall Xine right?
Or can it cause problems?
Since I was going to try to uninstall it and it's related packages.
But I'm not sure if it'll cause problems.
should be fine as its only a sound thingy
Alright, thanks
what video card?
lspci | grep -i vga
sudo apt-get install xserver-xgl
I get "E: Couldn't find package xserver-xgl". :<
if you run: gksudo nvidia-settings    what version of the driver are you running?
It says "NVIDIA Driver Version: 180.44"
http://pastebin.com/m60106f2b
if they gain you nothing after restarting X, delete them out
Alright I'm trying adding those lines to my xorg.conf file now. Should I do a full reboot after or?
no, simply save the file, close the editor then hit ctrl+alt+backspace once it is safe to log you out
Um, as bizarre as it is, CTRL+ALT+BACKSPACE does absolutely nothing. O_o
are you running jaunty?
Ya, the latest release candidate.
then reboot
Ok
you can re-enable ctrl+alt+ackspace
I'll have to try the changes I made to the xorg.conf file out tommorow. XD Thanks for the help! :D
